EDIT:
So I've decided not to use VHCS for a couple of reasons... First of all, it doesn't seem very easy to install.... There are install scripts out there that will do it for you, but none of them are updated for Ubuntu 9.04 or Debian 5.0.1. --Also, I ran across this article: <a href="
http://ubuntu-tutorials.com/2006/08/15/vhcs-v2471-pro-do-not-use" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://ubuntu-tutorials.com/2006/08/15/vhcs-v2471-pro-do-not-use</a> and many others I found on google by searching for VHCS HACK

So instead, I think I'll give SysCP a shot... It looks promising, has great documentation and installation guides, and it's being kept up to date: <a href="
http://www.syscp.org" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.syscp.org</a>

However, I will still continue to host the .torrent files I uploaded earlier in case others want to still give VHCS a shot and use these VM appliances...

FOR FULL DETAILS, VISIT: <a href=" http://www.vmware.com/appliances/directory/370" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.vmware.com/appliances/directory/370</a>




Operating System:
Debian Linux

Applications:
Apache HTTP Server version 2.0.54 (aka Apache2)
Debian Linux OS version 3.1 (aka Sarge)
Lynx Web Browser version 8.2.5
OpenSSH version 3.1.8
MySQL Database Tool version 4.1
PHP Development Tools version 4
VHCS Open Source Control Panel version 2.4.7
VMwareTools-5.5.1-19175

VHCS-VM was developed to provide a turn-key solution for
Virtual Web Servers with a fully functional Control Panel. This VMWare application
was built on the Debian Linux
operating system running Apache2.
I chose Debian for it's simplicity and ease of maintenance. The Control Panel
that is packaged with this virtual server appliance comes from the open source
project VHCS.
VHCS delivers a complete hosting automation appliance by
offering significant security, total-cost-of-ownership, and performance advantages
over competing commercial solutions. With VHCS you can configure your server
and applications, create users with domains with a few point-and-click operations
that take less than a minute. There is no limit to the number of resellers,
users and domains that can be created. At the core of VHCS are 3 easy-to-use,
Web-based control panels. VHCS provides graphic user interfaces for the administrators,
resellers and users.
VHCS-VM and VMWare
Server open the door a little more for someone to sell hosting
products. VHCS-VM uses the latest stable builds of VHCS and integrates
in a Linux Apache Webserver that is ready to be downloaded and run. You
can host multiple Virtual VHCS-VM Servers running on one VMWare Server.
What is VHCS?
VHCS is an Open Source Software Project that is dedicated to giving users,
administrators and developers the ultimate level of control over their Linux
web servers, web sites and their data. The goal of VHCS' group of developers
is to create software that is easy for everyone to use, not just to pile
on features. It has a wide VHCS community of support, and is supported by
the leading companies in Linux and Unix. VHCS was developed and is used to
support dozens of languages, and they strive to ensure that every piece of
VHCS software can be translated into all languages.
What does VHCS do?
For data center operations and Virtual WebHosting sellers, it maximizes
productivity and eases administrative burdens while improving the return-on-investment
by providing the following features:

    * Graphic user interfaces for the administrators, resellers and users.
    * Hosting services plan management - create your own hosting plans, that
      include a combination of hosting applications and server resources such
      as disk space and traffic.
    * Automated creation of users and domains.
    * Graphical evaluation of every reseller's and user's traffic.
    * Reduce the time required to manage web sites.

For server owners, their resellers, and their clients; VHCS shortens the
time and expertise required to deploy new sites. VHCS makes management of
sites, files, configurations and users easy, and provides all the services
anyone could need.

    * Virtual host management (Name-based, IP-based)
    * CO-Domains (Domain alias) and sub domains management
    * DNS (BIND 8 and 9) management
    * FTP users
    * E-mail addresses
    * POP3 and IMAP accounts
    * Auto responders
    * CGI, PHP,SSI configuration and management
    * MySQL user databases
    * Disk quotas
    * IP addresses
    * Backup and restore
    * SSL-secured domains
    * Password protection (.htaccess files)
    * Custom error files - 401, 403, 404 and 500
    * Traffic accounting
    * Multi language support
    * Skin-based graphic user interface - 4 pre-installed skins
